channel.title: Bread and Circuses - Forum Mafia (Finished ~ Town and Circus Host Win!)
channel.description:
# Welcome to [color=green]Bread[/color] and [color=purple]Circuses[/color]! ## An interesting custom game designed purely for fun! ### Information: This is a custom setup I've come up with recently, and wanted to test out! I would love to hear your feedback at the end of the game. For now, lets get right into the rolelist!
### Rolelist: [color=Green] Jailkeeper Doctor Doctor Doctor Bodyguard Baker Baker Baker Baker Baker [/color] [color=purple] Circus Freak Circus Freak Circus Freak [/color] [color=grey]Circus Host[/color]
> # [color=green] Jailkeeper [/color] > **Jail (Day)** - Choose a player to Jail. They will be prevented from taking any action. That night. You may freely talk to your jailed target. All actions targeting the jailed player, will be redirected to you. > **Execute (Night)** - Kill your jailed target. Bypasses night immunity. 3 uses.
> # [color=green] Doctor [/color] > **Separation Anxiety (Passive)** - If you are the last remaining [color=green]Doctor[/color], you will become a [color=purple]Circus Freak[/color]. This will be announced to the Town (The [color=green]Doctor[/color] is now a [color=purple]Circus Freak[/color]!) > **Heal (Night)** - Heal a player, preventing them from dying.
> # [color=green] Bodyguard [/color] > **Protect (Night)** - Protect a player. If the player is attacked, you will kill their attacker. Infinite Uses, 1 night cooldown after a successful guard.
> # [color=green] Baker [/color] > **Bake (Night)** - Bake some bread. Gain night immunity tonight. 1 use
> # [color=Purple] Circus Freak [/color] > **Chains (Passive)** - Immune to death at night > **Poor Luck (Passive)** - 10% chance to have your target changed > **Stab (Night)** - Kill a player
> # [color=grey] Circus Host [/color] > **Showmanship (Passive)** - When Lynched, you will reveal the roles of your first two accusers. > **Sold out! (Night)** - Prevent anyone from visiting you. 3 uses.
### Mechanics: The game is made up of 2 phases. The Day phase, and the Night phase. The Day phase lasts for 60 hours, whilst the Night phase only lasts 36 hours. During the Day, the players will vote for someone to kill. (/vote username) If Majority is reached before the end of the Day, the player will be killed, and Night will begin immediately. There will be no chats available to anyone outside of the forums. The [color=green]Jailkeeper[/color] and their target will communicate through the host. **This is a no flip gamemode. A player's role will not be revealed upon death.** ### Win Conditions: [color=green]The Town[/color] wins when there are no [color=purple]Circus Freaks[/color] remaining. [color=purple]The Circus Freaks[/color] win when there are no [color=green]Town[/color] remaining. [color=grey]The Circus Host[/color] wins when he is lynched.
### Players
1. Marluxion - Dead 2. Boss110 3. Pug - Dead 4. Hippolytus - Dead 5. eevee - Dead 6. Sam17z - Dead 7. PokemonKidRyan - Dead 8. Celeste_Lundenburg - Dead 9. NightX 10. Sketch - Dead 11. Quillian - Dead 12. Shurian 13. AsrielDreemurr 14. techwolves - Dead
**Reserve:** NozBugz

item.dc:creator: PokemonKidRyan
item.description:
Considering too that statistically is Renegade decides to kill N1-2.
Statistically, he’ll hit bakers more, as there are more of them.
Meaning that Bakers will be more readily eliminated.

Read full topic
item.source: Bread and Circuses - Forum Mafia (Finished ~ Town and Circus Host Win!)

item.title: Bread and Circuses - Forum Mafia (Finished ~ Town and Circus Host Win!)
item.dc:creator: PokemonKidRyan
item.description:
3 doctors who each have 2 heals = At least 2 nights of survival if not 3 guaranteed if outed early (Due to BG and Doc being able to cover them when they’ve used all heals on each other) which will lead to a huge advantage of time and confirmation PoE.

Bakers start off as majority but only get 1 immunity so can be killed any time except that time.
Docs and BGs would be much less likely to waste their resources on them.

Read full topic
item.source: Bread and Circuses - Forum Mafia (Finished ~ Town and Circus Host Win!)

item.title: Bread and Circuses - Forum Mafia (Finished ~ Town and Circus Host Win!)
item.dc:creator: Parfait
item.description:

Read full topic
item.source: Bread and Circuses - Forum Mafia (Finished ~ Town and Circus Host Win!)

item.title: Bread and Circuses - Forum Mafia (Finished ~ Town and Circus Host Win!)
item.dc:creator: PokemonKidRyan
item.description:
If anything, it’d be more useful to the Circus freaks if the Bakers were the ones who gained the convertible passive instead.
Don’t know how that would be worked, but to me it makes more sense since Baker’s are far less likely to be protected once docs/bgs out

Read full topic
item.source: Bread and Circuses - Forum Mafia (Finished ~ Town and Circus Host Win!)

item.title: Bread and Circuses - Forum Mafia (Finished ~ Town and Circus Host Win!)
item.dc:creator: PokemonKidRyan
item.description:
Fair enough, whatever works.
Just thought there should be some way to convert other things too.
As docs could out, have BGs on them.
Then once BG uses are done, they can heal each other.
The third doc and just heal one of the other 2 as well after that to significantly decrease chances of docs being converted

Read full topic
item.source: Bread and Circuses - Forum Mafia (Finished ~ Town and Circus Host Win!)

item.title: Bread and Circuses - Forum Mafia (Finished ~ Town and Circus Host Win!)
item.dc:creator: Parfait
item.description:
Conversion in addition to 3KPN is too much imo.
It’s also a no if it were to replace the nightkills. I feel like there wouldn’t be too much making this different from SFoL in that case.

Read full topic
item.source: Bread and Circuses - Forum Mafia (Finished ~ Town and Circus Host Win!)

item.title: Bread and Circuses - Forum Mafia (Finished ~ Town and Circus Host Win!)
item.dc:creator: PokemonKidRyan
item.description:
Hmmm, may be interesting to try.
What do you think of my idea of conversions?
As Baker is almost vanilla citizen but having to deal with the potential of being converted in their head all the time would be interesting.
Also, it’d make the Circus Freaks have to wait, build their numbers up and then all out attack well.

Read full topic
